intro: Triosteum levigatum, commonly known as the smooth triosteum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces small, oval fruits that contain two seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
